II. Buyback

The  total  of  20  buyback  offers  were 
received during 2012-13 indicating a decrease 
(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:345)(cid:343)(cid:561)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:344)(cid:351)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:158)(cid:162)(cid:139)(cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:148)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)
during  2011-12.  Out  of  the  17  cases  filed 
during  the  year  for  buyback  through  open 
market  purchase  method,  three  cases  were 
opened and closed and 14 cases were opened 
but  did  not  close.  Further,  there  were  three

3.

SUPERVISION
Supervision  of  intermediaries  through 
(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:556)(cid:156)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:283)(cid:556)(cid:156)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:154)(cid:158)(cid:146)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)
adjudications in case of violation of rules and 
regulations and administrative and statutory 
actions  are  essential  features  of  effective 
enforcement by SEBI.

SEBI  conducts  inspections  directly  as 
well  as  through  organisations  like  stock 
exchanges,  depositories,  etc.  Inspections  on 
a  periodic  basis  were  conducted  to  verify 
the  compliance  levels  of  intermediaries. 
Special purpose i.e. theme based inspections 
were also conducted on the basis of investor 
complaints,  references,  surveillance  reports, 
specific  concerns,  etc.  Special  purpose 
inspections of major stock exchanges as well 
as  the  depositories  were  also  carried  out  in 

(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:161)(cid:138)(cid:150)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:154)(cid:158)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:162)(cid:561)
of  their  audit/inspections  and  the  action 
taking process.

I.

Promotion and Regulation of Self 
Regulatory Organisations
SEBI  (Self  Regulatory  Organisations) 
(cid:20)(cid:142)(cid:144)(cid:158)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:344)(cid:342)(cid:342)(cid:346)(cid:561)(cid:160)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:151)(cid:152)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:8)(cid:142)(cid:139)(cid:155)(cid:158)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:162)(cid:561)
19,  2004  with  the  objective  to  promote 
organisation  of  intermediaries  representing 
a particular segment of the securities market 
as  a  self  regulated  entity  /  organisation.  For 
recognition of organisation of intermediaries 
as SROs, SEBI held discussions with various 
bodies like Association of Merchant Bankers 
of India (AMBI), Association of NSE Members 
of India (ANMI) and Registrars Association of 
India (RAIN). The various measures taken in 
2012-13 for promotion and regulation of Self 
Regulatory Organisations are:
(cid:3)(cid:495)(cid:561)

(cid:561) (cid:22)(cid:152)(cid:561) (cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:139)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:308)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:158)(cid:153)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:21)(cid:20)(cid:17)(cid:561) (cid:143)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:561)
distributors,  SEBI  (Self  Regulatory 
O r g a n i s a t i o n s )  
( A m e n d m e n t s ) 
Regulations,  2013  w.e.f.  January  7, 
(cid:344)(cid:342)(cid:343)(cid:345)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:141)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561)
of  distributor  and  issuer,  revised  the 
(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:162)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:157)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)
that a distributor shall be deemed to be 
an intermediary.

B. Under Regulation 14 of SEBI (Investment 
Advisers)  Regulations,  2013,  SEBI  may 
recognise  any  body  or  body  corporate 

118

for the purpose of regulating investment 
advisers  and  delegate  administration 
and  supervision  of  investment  advisers 
to  such  body  or  body  corporate.  As 
decided in the Board Meeting in which 
the  Regulations  were  approved,  SEBI 
will  directly  register  and  regulate  the 
Investment  Advisors  till  such  time  an 
SRO is recognised for the purpose.

II.

Inspection of Market 
Intermediaries
The  number  of  inspections  has 
substantially  increased  from  111  in  the 
(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561) (cid:162)(cid:142)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:344)(cid:342)(cid:343)(cid:343)(cid:556)(cid:343)(cid:344)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561) (cid:345)(cid:342)(cid:342)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561)
year  2012-13.  The  inspection  process  of 
intermediaries  has  been  further  streamlined 
with  a  view  to  improve  the  quality  such 
as  selection  of  themes  for  inspections, 
questionnaire  for  inspections  and  follow  up 
action.

(cid:4)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:143)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)
considering the comments of intermediaries, 
(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:160)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:149)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:141)(cid:159)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:139)(cid:152)(cid:158)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:561)
where  improvement  was  required  by  them. 
They  were  also  required  to  report  to  SEBI 
about  the  corrective  steps  taken  by  them 
and  also  place  the  same  before  their  board/
partners/proprietor, as the case may be. These 
steps taken by SEBI have improved the level 
of  compliance  among  the  intermediaries. 
Administrative  and  quasi-judicial  actions 
(cid:160)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:139)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)
(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:158)(cid:156)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:159)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:150)(cid:150)(cid:146)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)
intermediaries.

Part Three: Regulation of Securities Market

A.

Inspection of Stock Brokers
During  the  year  2012-13,  162  stock 
brokers  have  been  inspected  as  against  69 
(cid:141)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:162)(cid:142)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:344)(cid:342)(cid:343)(cid:343)(cid:556)(cid:343)(cid:344)(cid:495)(cid:561) (cid:21)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:153)(cid:152)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:561)
risk-based  inspections  were  carried  out 
during the year. The focus of the inspections 
included  themes  such  as  compliance  of 
norms  regarding  Anti-money  Laundering, 
(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:308)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:140)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:149)(cid:162)(cid:561)
basis,  Segregation  of  clients  and  proprietary 
funds/securities,  KYC  norms,  clearing 
operations,  etc.  During  inspections,  the 
compliance  of  specific  provisions  of  SEBI 
(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:144)(cid:158)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:550)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:155)(cid:140)(cid:158)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:160)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:495)(cid:561)(cid:22)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:157)(cid:138)(cid:146)(cid:149)(cid:156)(cid:561)
of inspection of stock brokers and sub-brokers 
carried out are given in Table 3.16.

B.

Inspection of Other Intermediaries
Special  focus  inspections  of  inter-
mediaries are undertaken by SEBI to ascertain 
(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:161)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:150)(cid:153)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:495)

SEBI carried out inspection of merchant 
bankers to check the due diligence exercised 
in respect of pre-issue and post-issue activities. 
Apart  from  such  due  diligence  inspections, 
inspections  of  merchant  bankers  were  also 
carried out to ascertain compliance with SEBI 
Circular on disclosure of track record of public 
issues managed by merchant bankers.

Inspection  of  registrars  to  an  issue  was 
carried  out  to  check  the  allotment  process 
followed  and  the  redressal  of  investor 
complaints.  Besides,  inspections  of  share 
transfer  agents  including  in-house  share 
transfer  agents  were  conducted  to  ascertain 
the  process  followed  by  them  in  executing 
investor  requests  such  as  transmission,  etc. 
and  the  Disaster  Recovery  and  Business 
Continuity Plan (DR&BCP) adopted by them.
SEBI conducted inspections of debenture 
trustees based on the number of public issues 
(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:139)(cid:162)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561) (cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:281)(cid:155)(cid:150)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:150)(cid:153)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:561)
with the applicable regulatory and statutory 
requirements  with  focus  on  their  systems 
and  controls  with  respect  to  monitoring  of 
payment  of  interest/  redemption  amount, 
processing of investor grievances and action 

taken in case of defaults by issuer companies.
Inspection  of  Portfolio  Managers  were 
conducted so to ascertain various compliance 
requirements  including  the  Know  Your 
Client  (KYC)  due  diligence  carried  out  by 
the  Portfolio  Manager.  A  total  of  seven 
inspections  were  carried  out.  Further,  58 
pre-registration/renewal  visits  of  portfolio 
managers were conducted. This was primarily 
done to check the general compliance level in 
the portfolio managers.

During  2012-13,  inspections  were 
completed  for  51  depository  participants,  16 
(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:148)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:281)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:144)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:496)(cid:561)
10 debenture trustees and 17 RTI & STA. The 
total  number  of  inspections  conducted  by 
SEBI  of  these  intermediaries  has  increased 
substantially during the year, from 30 in 2011-
12  to  99  in  2012-13  (Table  3.17).  There  was 
special  focus  on  follow-up  action  after  the 
inspections so that corrective steps are taken 
by the intermediaries.

V. Prevention of Money Laundering

(cid:15)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:144)(cid:149)(cid:152)(cid:139)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:149)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:144)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:163)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)
as  one  of  the  largest  threats  posed  to  the 
financial  system  of  a  country.  The  fight 
(cid:138)(cid:144)(cid:138)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:152)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:561)
emerging  threat  with  grave  consequences 
for both the political and economic standing 
of  a  jurisdiction.  Rapid  developments  and 
(cid:144)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:144)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561) (cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:148)(cid:142)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561)
together  with  improvements  in  technology 
and  communication  channels  continue  to 
pose  serious  challenges  to  the  authorities 
and  institutions  dealing  with  anti-money 
laundering  and  combating  financing  of 
terrorism (AML and CFT).

(cid:150)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:150)(cid:496)(cid:561)

(FATF)  standards.  (Box  3.1  may  be  referred 
for details)

B.

Inspections on AML/CFT related issues
SEBI  has  appropriately  included  the 
AML/CFT  risks  as  part  of  its  inspection 

122

of  intermediaries,  such  as,  stock  brokers, 
depository  participants  and  mutual  funds. 
SEBI  has  also  carried  out  specific  theme 
based  inspections  of  intermediaries  focusing 
on  compliance  with  KYC  norms  (which 
includes  Client  Due  Diligence)  and  AML/
(cid:5)(cid:8)(cid:22)(cid:561)(cid:144)(cid:158)(cid:146)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:495)(cid:561)(cid:11)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:158)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:561)
purpose inspections of stock brokers to check 
their  compliance  with  KYC  norms,  which 
were conducted last year, in 2012-13 SEBI has 
carried out 40 special purpose inspections of 
stock brokers to check their compliance with 
the AML/CFT framework that has been put in 
place. Further 35 inspections of stock brokers 
and  six  depository  participants  focusing  on 
compliance with KYC norms have also been 
carried  out  in  2012-13.  In  addition  to  the 
special  purpose  inspections  conducted  by 
SEBI, compliance with AML/CFT norms is also 
(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:140)(cid:148)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:161)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:153)(cid:152)(cid:156)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)
during their inspections of stock brokers and 
depository  participants  and  also  at  the  time 
of half yearly internal audits by independent 
professionals.  Depository  participants  are 
also  required  to  undergo  concurrent  audits 
with  respect  to  their  operations,  which 
includes  account  opening/KYC/AML  norms. 
Appropriate  sanctions  are  applied  where 
AML/CFT  violations/discrepancies  are 
observed. Further, the penalty structure of the 
stock  exchanges  has  been  recently  reviewed 
and  the  penalties  imposed  for  KYC  and 
AML/CFT discrepancies/violations have been 
suitably enhanced.

The table given below provides data on 
the  number  of  members/participants  against 
whom action for AML/CFT discrepancies has 
been taken by the exchanges and depositories 
in 2012-13:

Part Three: Regulation of Securities Market

and/or persons on whose behalf a transaction is being conducted, and includes a person who exercises ultimate

For clients other than individuals or trusts: Intermediaries are required to take reasonable measures to verify the 
identity of the:
i.

natural person, who, whether acting alone or together, or through one or more juridical person, exercises 
control through ownership or who ultimately has a controlling ownership interest in the client Controlling 
ownership interest means ownership of/entitlement to:

(cid:138)(cid:508)(cid:561) (cid:150)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:344)(cid:347)(cid:406)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:153)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:153)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:281)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:147)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:160)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:147)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:561)

company,

(cid:139)(cid:508)(cid:561) (cid:150)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:343)(cid:347)(cid:406)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:153)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:281)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:147)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:160)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:147)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:561)

is an unincorporated association or body of individuals

ii.

interests, the identity of the natural person exercising control over the juridical person through other means.
a) Control through other means can be exercised through voting rights, agreement, arrangements or in any 

other manner.

Exemption in case of listed companies: Where the client or the owner of the controlling interest is a company 
listed on a stock exchange, or is a majority-owned subsidiary of such a company, it is not necessary to identify and

based  on  information  received  from  various 
member jurisdictions, in the meetings of EAG 
plenary  held  in  May  2012  and  November 
2012.

4.

SURVEILLANCE

I. Market Surveillance Mechanism

The  key  objective  of  surveillance  is  the 
prevention  and  investigation  of  abusive, 
manipulative or illegal trading practices in the 
securities  markets.  Market  surveillance  aims 
to ensure orderly markets, where buyers and 
sellers are willing to participate because they 
(cid:143)(cid:142)(cid:142)(cid:149)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:281)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:143)(cid:138)(cid:146)(cid:155)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:140)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)
transactions.  In  Indian  context,  the  primary 
responsibility of market surveillance has been 
entrusted to the stock exchanges and in order 
(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:146)(cid:149)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:161)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:142)(cid:496)(cid:561)
independent surveillance cells have also been 
established in stock exchanges. The objective 
of  surveillance  is  to  ensure  that  these  cells
(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:143)(cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:561) (cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:146)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:142)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:561)
manner.

At  SEBI,  the  Integrated  Surveillance 
Department  (ISD)  is  in  charge  of  overall 
market surveillance and scope of its activities 
includes monitoring market movements and 
detecting  potential  breach  of  Regulations, 

124

Part Three: Regulation of Securities Market

analysing  the  trading  in  securities  and 
initiation  of  appropriate  action  wherever 
warranted.

Presently  Phase  I  and  II  are  fully 
operational. Phase III is also complete and has 
been released for User Acceptance Test (UAT).

II.

Integrated Market Surveillance 
System (IMSS)
Integrated  Market  Surveillance  System 
(IMSS)  continues  to  provide  SEBI  assistance 
in  monitoring  the  securities  market  and 
in  discharging  its  regulatory  functions 
(cid:142)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:149)(cid:162)(cid:495)(cid:561)(cid:22)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:162)(cid:156)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:561)(cid:148)(cid:142)(cid:142)(cid:153)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:148)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:148)(cid:142)(cid:157)(cid:561)
aberrations  and  generates  alerts  on  a  daily 
(cid:139)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:495)(cid:561) (cid:22)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:162)(cid:163)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:149)(cid:162)(cid:561)
(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:160)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:160)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)
for  investigation  and  for  further  action.  The 
purpose of this exercise is to promote market 
integrity and to ensure orderly conduct of the 
market.

During  the  year,  SEBI  upgraded  the 
IMSS  system  to  handle  more  than  2  billion 
records  in  a  day.  To  further  enhance  the 
system  capability  and  performance  of  alert 
generation process, implementation of rolling 
(cid:139)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:148)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:148)(cid:142)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:308)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:150)(cid:561)
are underway.

Intelligence System (DWBIS)
(cid:6)(cid:25)(cid:4)(cid:11)(cid:21)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:147)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:153)(cid:157)(cid:158)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:163)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)

V. Surveillance Actions

During  financial  year  2012-13,  NSE 
initiated  preliminary  examination  and 
investigation  in  85  cases  and  BSE  initiated 
preliminary examination and investigation in 
885  cases. Apart  from  above,  as  surveillance 
(cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:141)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561) (cid:162)(cid:142)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:344)(cid:342)(cid:343)(cid:344)(cid:556)(cid:343)(cid:345)(cid:561) (cid:16)(cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:561)
shifted  336  scrips  to  trade  to  trade  (T  to  T) 
segment and similarly BSE shifted 1,151 scrips 
to  trade  to  trade  (T  to  T)  segment.  In  this 
(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:144)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:140)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:153)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:308)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:158)(cid:144)(cid:145)(cid:561)
mandatory  delivery  and  no  netting  off 
positions are allowed. This leads to reduction 
in  the  amount  of  speculation  as  only  those 
who can deliver the securities can enter into 
sale  transactions  and  thereby  speculation  is 
reduced.  Further,  with  a  view  to  dampen 
the  amplitude  of  prices,  scrips  shifted  to

125

Annual Report 2012-13

T  to  T  segment  attract  applicable  circuit 
filters.  NSE  reduced  circuit  filter  in  693 
instances and BSE in 1,652 instances. Further, 
(cid:16)(cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:4)(cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:561) (cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:351)(cid:346)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:343)(cid:342)(cid:342)(cid:561) (cid:155)(cid:158)(cid:150)(cid:152)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:496)(cid:561)
respectively  (Table  3.19).  MCX-SX  being  a 
new  exchange  in  equities,  has  not  initiated 
(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:162)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:141)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561) (cid:162)(cid:142)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:344)(cid:342)(cid:343)(cid:344)(cid:556)

(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:308)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561) (cid:22)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561) (cid:22)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:144)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:158)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)

VI. Surveillance Measures

SEBI  conducts  meetings  at  regular 
intervals  with  stock  exchanges  to  monitor 
their  surveillance  activities  and  market 
movements.  In  consultation  with  the  stock 
exchanges,  the  following  surveillance 
measures have been taken:
a.

SEBI  has  advised  the  Exchanges  to 
put  a  penalty  of  ` 10,000  (Rupees  ten 
thousand  only)  on  brokers  who  are 
(cid:153)(cid:158)(cid:308)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:160)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:152)(cid:158)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:158)(cid:153)(cid:149)(cid:152)(cid:138)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:23)(cid:5)(cid:5)(cid:561)
and PAN details.

b. Companies  are  required  to  make 
disclosures  in  respect  of  price 
sensitive  information  to  stock 
exchanges  particularly  flowing  from 
SEBI  (Prohibition  of  Insider  Trading 
(PIT))  Regulations,  1992  and  Listing 
agreement.  SEBI  advised  the  exchanges

(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:158)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:150)(cid:152)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:281)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)
of  information  so  that  the  authenticity 
of  the  source  of  the  information  is 
ascertained  by  the  exchanges  before 
disseminating the same.

In  order  to  discharge  their  surveillance 
responsibilities  effectively,  SEBI 
has  reviewed  and  strengthened  the 
Surveillance  Committee  of  the  stock 
exchanges.

SEBI  has  mandated  all  Exchanges 
to  disseminate  for  each  derivative 
stock,  the  combined  open  position 
of  group  of  connected  entities  on  the 
respective  Exchange  website  twice  a 
month without disclosing the individual 
names.  The  criteria  for  determining 
connected entities and methodology for 
dissemination  of  combined  positions 
have also been prescribed by SEBI.

In order to arrest any further misconduct 
in the market by trading entities, it was 
decided  that  the  exchanges  shall  issue 
(cid:152)(cid:139)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:159)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:550)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:158)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:561)
entities whose behaviour is found to be 
aberrant and prima facie does not appear 
to  be  in  conformity  with  the  extant 
securities  law  governing  the  securities 
market.

VII. Enforcement Actions

A.

(cid:138)(cid:495)(cid:561)

Interim orders:

(cid:11)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:150)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:153)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:143)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:149)(cid:561)
in certain scrips on July 26, 2012

On  July  26,  2012,  SEBI  noticed  an 
abrupt  downward  movement  in  prices  of 
certain  scrips  namely  M/s.  Pipavav  Defence 
and  Offshore  Eng.  Ltd.,  M/s.  Parsvanath 
Developers  Ltd.,  M/s.  Tulip  Telecom  Ltd. 
and  M/s.  Glodyne  Technoserve  Ltd.  as 
compared  to  their  closing  prices  on  July 
25,  2012  at  NSE  and  BSE. After  preliminary 
analysis,  SEBI,  vide  its  order  dated  August 
03,  2012  banned  19  entities  from  accessing 
securities market and prohibiting them from 
buying, selling or dealing in securities in any 
manner  whatsoever,  till  further  directions 
(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:495)(cid:561) (cid:18)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:139)(cid:152)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:143)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)
considering  the  submissions  made  by  these 
19 entities, (cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:4)(cid:11)(cid:561)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:281)(cid:155)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:561)
against eight entities.

b.

Interim  order  in  the  matter  of  M/s. 
Ruchi Soya Industries Ltd.
SEBI  carried  out  an  examination  in  the 
scrip  of  M/s.  Ruchi  Soya  Industries  Ltd.  in 
view of surveillance alerts regarding ‘marking 
(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:140)(cid:149)(cid:152)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:514)(cid:495)(cid:561) (cid:22)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:149)(cid:162)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:150)(cid:153)(cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)

Part Three: Regulation of Securities Market

the  closing  price  in  cash  market,  which  acts 
(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:308)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:148)(cid:142)(cid:157)(cid:561)
is  known  as  ‘marking  the  close’  in  common 
parlance. Examination, prima facie, revealed 
that  certain  connected  entities  indulged  in 
‘marking  the  close’  by  moving  the  closing 
price  of  the  said  scrip  in  the  cash  market  in 
(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:153)(cid:158)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:143)(cid:138)(cid:146)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)
and thereby made unlawful gain on the long 
positions held by them in futures of the scrip.
SEBI,  passed  an  interim  order  dated 
February  15,  2013  against  nine  connected 
entities  restraining  them  from  accessing 
securities market and prohibiting them from 
buying, selling or dealing in securities in any 
manner whatsoever, till further directions in 
(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:140)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:153)(cid:495)(cid:561)(cid:17)(cid:153)(cid:153)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:157)(cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:162)(cid:561)
to these entities to submit their submissions in 
(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:142)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:144)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:495)

c.

Interim  order  in  the  matter  of  M/s. 
Zenith Infotech Ltd.
SEBI observed that M/s. Zenith Infotech 
Ltd.  (ZIL)  raised  US$  33  &  US$  50  million 
by  issuing  ‘FCCBs  which  were  due  for 
redemption  in  September  2011  and  August 
2012,  respectively.  ZIL  in  its  EGM  held  on 
January  29,  2011  took  approval  from  its 
shareholders to sell its assets for repayment/
redemption  of  FCCBs  due  for  maturity. 
On  September  26,  2011,  ZIL  announced  to 
exchanges that it has sold one of its divisions, 
(Managed Services Division) MSD, to Zenith 
RMM LLC.

Examination,  prima  facie,  revealed 
that  the  substantial  portion  of  sale  proceeds 
of  MSD  Division  of  ZIL  was  diverted  in  a

restraining  them  from  accessing  securities

5.

INVESTIGATION
Timely completion of investigation cases 
(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:142)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:153)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:561)
action  in  case  of  violations  of  established 
securities  laws  is  important  for  protection 
of  investors’  interest  and  ensuring  fair, 
transparent  and  orderly  functioning  of  the 
market.  It  is  also  vital  for  improving  the 
(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:281)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:144)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:162)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)
market.  SEBI  is  therefore  constantly  striving 
to upgrade its investigative skills by making 
use  of  Information  Technology.  Importance 
(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:139)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:158)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:144)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561)
has  also  been  underscored  by  IOSCO  in  its 
“Principles for the Enforcement of Securities 
Regulation”.

Keeping  the  above  objectives  and 
principles  of  securities  regulations  in  view, 
SEBI initiates investigation to examine alleged 
or suspected violations of laws and obligations 
relating  to  securities  market.  The  possible 
violations  may  include  price  manipulation, 
(cid:140)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561) (cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:148)(cid:142)(cid:157)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:146)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:496)(cid:561)
capital  issue  related  irregularities,  takeover 
related violations, non-compliance of disclosure 
requirements and any other misconduct in the 
securities markets.

I.

Initiation of Investigation
There are various sources of information 
for  initiation  of  investigation.  SEBI  initiates 
investigation  based  on  reference  received 
from  sources  such  as  stock  exchanges, 
internal  surveillance  department,  other 
government  departments,  information 
submitted  by  market  participants  and 
complainants.  In  appropriate  cases, 
investigation may also be initiated suo-moto, 
where there are reasonable grounds to believe 
those investors’ interests are being adversely 
(cid:138)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:159)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)
the provisions of the securities laws.

Part Three: Regulation of Securities Market

II. Process of Investigation

The steps involved during investigation 
process  include  an  analysis  of  market  data 
(order  and  trade  log,  transaction  statements 
etc.) and static data (KYC documents obtained 
from  brokers,  depository  participants  etc., 
(cid:139)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:148)(cid:561)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:141)(cid:156)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:149)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)
major  corporate  developments  etc.)  The 
purpose  of  such  investigation  is  to  gather 
evidence  and  to  identify  persons/  entities 
behind  irregularities  and  violations  so  that 
appropriate  and  suitable  regulatory  action 
can  be  taken,  wherever  required.  Outcome 
of  investigation  in  the  form  of  enforcement 
action is a clear signal to the market players 
to  comply  with  the  law  and  expected 
standards of conduct in the market.

III. Trends in Investigation Cases

Since  1992-93,  SEBI  has  undertaken 
1,772  investigation  cases.  In  1,539  cases, 

investigations  have  been  completed.  Apart 
from  enforcement  action,  an  important 
attendant  benefit  resulting  from  such 
investigations  is  contribution  to  the  policy 
changes  with  a  view  to  further  strengthen 
the regulatory and enforcement environment. 
During  2012-13,  155  new  cases  were  taken 
up  for  investigation  and  119  cases  were 
completed (Table 3.20 and Chart 3.3).

A. Nature of Investigation Cases Taken Up
During 2012-13, about 55 percent of the 
cases  taken  up  for  investigation  pertain  to 
market  manipulation  and  price  rigging,  as 
against about 47 percent of such cases in the 
previous year. Other cases pertain to insider 
trading,  takeover  violations,  irregularities 
in  capital  issues,  and  other  violations  of 
securities  laws.  Since,  several  investigation 
cases  involve  multiple  allegations  of 
(cid:159)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:160)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:556)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:144)(cid:145)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:140)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)
(cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:144)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:284)(cid:140)(cid:158)(cid:149)(cid:157)(cid:495)(cid:561)(cid:22)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:143)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:496)(cid:561)

B. Nature  of  Investigation  Cases 

Completed
During  2012-13,  about  44  percent  of 
the  cases  completed  pertain  to  issue  related 
to  manipulation  and  34  percent  of  the  cases 
completed  pertain  to  market  manipulation 
and  price  rigging.  Other  cases  in  which 
investigation  was  completed  pertain  to 
insider  trading,  takeovers  etc.  The  details  of 
investigation  cases  taken  up  and  completed 
are  provided  in  Table  3.21,  Chart  3.4  and 
Chart 3.5.

IV. Regulatory Action

After completion of investigation, penal 
action  is  initiated  as  approved  by  the 
competent  authority  wherever  violations  of 
laws  and  obligations  relating  to  securities 
market is observed. Action is decided based 
on  the  principles  of  objectivity,  consistency, 
materiality and quality of evidence available, 
after  thorough  analysis  and  appreciation  of 
facts.

The  action  included  issuing  warning 
letters,  initiating  enquiry  proceedings 
for  registered  intermediaries,  initiating 
adjudication proceedings for levy of monetary 
penalties, passing directions under Section 11

A. Orders under Section 11B of SEBI Act, 

a.

1992
Based  on  the  complaints  received 
regarding cheating and misappropriation 
of  several  crores  of  Rupees  by  M/s 
Stock  Guru  India,  SEBI  had  initiated 
examination  in  the  said  matter.  The 
activity  of  M/s  Stock  Guru  appeared 
to  be  a  Multi  Level  Marketing  (MLM) 
Scheme. However, SEBI found that one of 
its group companies, M/s. SGI Research 
and  Analysis  Ltd.,  issued  convertible 
preference  shares  of  ` 10/-  each  at  a 
premium  of  Rs.1,500  per  share  to  more 
than  50  investors,  thereby,  violating 
Regulation  4(2),  5(1),  5(7),  6,  7,  25,  26, 
46  and  59  of  SEBI  (ICDR)  Regulation 
and  Regulation  3(b),  4(1)  and  4(2)(r)  of 
SEBI(PFUTP)  Regulations.  Thereafter, 
11B  Order  was  passed  on  January  11, 

2013  restraining  M/s  SGI  Research  and 
Analysis  Ltd.  and  its  7  directors  from 
accessing  the  securities  market  and 
further prohibited from buying, selling or 
otherwise dealing in securities and being 
associated  with  the  securities  market 
directly  or  indirectly  for  a  period  of  10 
years.  The  Order  further  directed  the 
company and its directors to refund the 
money  collected  towards  subscription 
of  convertible  preference  shares  to  the 
subscribers  of  M/s.  SGI  Research  and 
Analysis Ltd. along with the interest of 
15 percent per annum.

b. M/s  Sarang  Chemicals  Limited  was 
debarred  for  a  period  of  two  years  in 
the  matter  of  M/s  Sarang  Chemicals 
Limited  for  publishing  misleading 
corporate  announcements,  incorrect 
financial  results,  wrong  shareholding 
(cid:153)(cid:138)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:151)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:150)(cid:153)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:143)(cid:138)(cid:146)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:148)(cid:142)(cid:561)
relevant  disclosures  regarding  change 
in  shareholding  as  required  by  the 
SEBI  (Substantial  Acquisition  of  Shares 
and  Takeovers)  Regulations,  1997  and 
SEBI  (Prohibition  of  Insider  Trading) 
Regulations, 1992, etc.

B. Adjudication Orders
a.

The  promoters  of  Bank  of  Rajasthan 
(BoR) in compliance with RBI Guidelines 
disclosed  that  they  have  reduced  their 
shareholding in BoR from 44.18 percent 
in June 2007 to 28.61 percent in December 
2009 of the issued capital. However, in the 
garb  of  reduction,  they  had  transferred 
(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:146)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:283)(cid:556)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:148)(cid:142)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561)(cid:15)(cid:550)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:22)(cid:138)(cid:162)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561)(cid:550)(cid:561)
Yadav / Silvassa Group entities who were 
their  PACs  (persons  acting  in  concert). 
Instead of reduction from 44.18 percent 
to  28.61  percent  the  promoters  along 
with  PACs  (Tayal,  Silvassa  and  Yadav 
Groups)  increased  their  shareholding 
from 44.18 percent in quarter ended June 
2007  to  63.15  percent  in  quarter  ended 
December 2009. The disclosures of the so 
called  reduced  promoters  holding  were 
disseminated  in  the  market  by  way  of 
(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:158)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:281)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:160)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:140)(cid:148)(cid:561) (cid:142)(cid:161)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:495)(cid:561)
Summons  were  issued  to  all  promoter 
of  BoR,  M/s  Tayal  Group,  M/s  Yadav 
Group  and  M/s  Silvassa  Group  entities 
however they did not co-operate with the 
investigation. Adjudication  proceedings 
were  initiated  against  142  entities  for 
violation  of  SEBI  (PFUTP)  Reg.,  SEBI 
(SAST)  Reg.,  SEBI  (PIT)  Reg.  and  non 
compliance  of  summons.  Adjudication 
proceedings  were  completed  against 
141  entities  and  a  total  penalty  of  Rs 
29,97,50,000 was imposed.

SEBI  had  levied  penalty  of  ` 5  lakh  in

Order  dated  30/01/2013,  certificate  of 
registration of M/s NCJ Share and Stock 
Brokers Ltd. was suspended for a period 
of  one  week.  The  noticee  while  trading 
in  its  proprietary  account  has  dealt  in 
the scrip of SIL in a manner detrimental 
to  the  interest  of  investors.  Such  acts 
threaten the market integrity and orderly 
development of the market and call for 
regulatory  intervention  to  protect  the 
interest  of  investors  as  the  same  pose 
serious  threat  to  the  price  discovery 
mechanism  of  the  stock  exchange  and 
the  safety  of  the  securities  market 
mechanism.

(cid:24)(cid:495)(cid:561) (cid:8)(cid:152)(cid:149)(cid:149)(cid:152)(cid:160)(cid:556)(cid:158)(cid:153)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:11)(cid:151)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:144)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)

After  completion  of  investigation,  the 
Investigation  Department  is  also  actively 

136

involved  in  post-investigation  enforcement 
actions  and  quasi-judicial  proceedings.  Such 
actions  include  issuing  show  cause  notices 
to  the  entities,  examining  their  replies, 
organising and participating in the hearings of 
the entities before the Whole Time Members 
of  SEBI,  co-ordination  with  Enforcement 
Department  (EFD),  preparing  draft  orders, 
issuing  press  releases  after  orders  are 
(cid:153)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:142)(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:141)(cid:159)(cid:152)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)
replying  to  their  queries,  co-ordination  with 
Enforcement Department in the proceedings 
before Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) and 
before courts, co-ordination with Prosecution 
Department  for  cases  filed  in  the  courts, 
follow-up for collection of penalty after orders 
(cid:153)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:139)(cid:162)(cid:561) (cid:3)(cid:141)(cid:147)(cid:158)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:17)(cid:284)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)
prosecution  for  non-payment  of  penalties, 
processing  of  consent  proposals  filed  by 
the  entities,  etc.  Timely  and  qualitative 
completion of such actions is also important 
(cid:143)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:142)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:144)(cid:158)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:162)(cid:561)
measures taken by SEBI.

6.

ENFORCEMENT OF 
REGULATIONS
Effective  enforcement  in  the  form  of 
(cid:142)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:143)(cid:152)(cid:149)(cid:149)(cid:152)(cid:160)(cid:556)(cid:158)(cid:153)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:153)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:162)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:561)
(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:148)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:561)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:144)(cid:158)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:162)(cid:156)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:495)

I.

Enforcement Mechanisms
(cid:22)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:281)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:143)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:150)(cid:156)(cid:561)
that  SEBI  uses  in  case  of  any  violation(s) 
pertaining  to  the  laws  regulating  the 
securities  market.  Age-wise  analysis  of 
(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:143)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:157)(cid:138)(cid:146)(cid:149)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:159)(cid:146)(cid:163)(cid:495)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:561)
u/s  11,  11B  and  11D  of  SEBI  Act,  enquiry 
proceedings,  adjudication  proceedings, 
prosecution  proceedings  and  summary 
proceedings  as  on  March  31,  2013  are 
provided in Tables 3.23 to Table 3.23d.

Part Three: Regulation of Securities Market

A. Section 11/11B Proceedings

or registration.

Under section 11/11B of SEBI Act, 1992, 
SEBI  may  issue  directions  or  prohibitive 
orders such as debarment from accessing the 
securities market or not to deal in securities. 
In  2012-13,  142  cases  under  section  11/11B 
(cid:160)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:152)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:4)(cid:11)(cid:495)(cid:561)(cid:11)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:138)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561)
year,  184  fresh  cases  under  the  caption 
provision of law were initiated by SEBI. The 
cumulative  pending  cases  as  on  March  31, 
2013 were 1,016 (Table 3.23).

B.

Enquiry Proceedings
(cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:4)(cid:11)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:149)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:561)
of  registration  of  an  intermediary  through 
Enquiry Regulations on the recommendation 
(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:154)(cid:158)(cid:146)(cid:155)(cid:162)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:284)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:550)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:146)(cid:144)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:158)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:162)(cid:561)
appointed for that purpose. It may also issue 
warning to an intermediary if it considers that 
(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:159)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:150)(cid:150)(cid:146)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:162)(cid:561)
does  not  warrant  suspension  or  cancellation 

In  the  financial  year  2012-13,  36 
cases  were  disposed  by  SEBI  after  the  due 
completion  of  enquiry  proceedings.  In  the 
same  financial  year,  27  fresh  cases  were 
initiated where enquiry proceedings are being 
followed. The cumulative pending cases as on 
March 31, 2013 stands at 114. (Table 3.23)

C. Adjudication Proceedings

Under  Chapter  VIA  of  SEBI  Act,  1992, 
(cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:4)(cid:11)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:153)(cid:153)(cid:152)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:3)(cid:141)(cid:147)(cid:158)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)(cid:17)(cid:284)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:143)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:561)
conducting  enquiry  and  imposing  penalties. 
In  2012-13,  485  cases  were  disposed  by 
SEBI under adjudicating proceedings. In the 
(cid:156)(cid:138)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561) (cid:162)(cid:142)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:343)(cid:496)(cid:347)(cid:346)(cid:350)(cid:561) (cid:143)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:145)(cid:561) (cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:160)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)
initiated under adjudicating proceedings. The 
cumulative  pending  cases  as  on  March  31, 
2013 stands at 2,333 (Table 3.23b).

Section  24  of  the  SEBI  Act,  1992 
empowers  SEBI  to  launch  prosecution 
against  any  person  for  contravention  of  any 
provision of the SEBI Act, 1992 or any rules 
or  regulations  made  there  under  before  a 
court  of  criminal  jurisdiction.  In  2012-13,  22 
(cid:153)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:158)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:281)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:4)(cid:11)(cid:561)(cid:160)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:152)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)
by  courts  and  75  new  cases  were  initiated. 
The  cumulative  pending  cases  as  on  March 
31, 2013 stands at 988. (Table 3.23c)

E.

Summary Proceedings
Chapter VA of the SEBI (Intermediaries) 
Regulations,  2008  provides  the  power  to 
conduct  summary  proceedings  in  certain 
(cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:495)(cid:561)(cid:11)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:344)(cid:342)(cid:343)(cid:344)(cid:556)(cid:343)(cid:345)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:151)(cid:152)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:143)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:150)(cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:162)(cid:561)
proceedings were disposed as well as initiated 
by SEBI. The cumulative pending cases as on

B. M/s.  NGHI  Developers  India  Ltd. 

(NGHI):
It came to the notice of SEBI that NGHI 
and  its  promoters/  directors  are  engaged  in 
(cid:513)(cid:143)(cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:150)(cid:152)(cid:139)(cid:146)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:163)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:162)(cid:514)(cid:561) (cid:143)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:150)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:158)(cid:139)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:139)(cid:162)(cid:561)
(cid:282)(cid:152)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:550)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:153)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:550)(cid:561) (cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:5)(cid:11)(cid:21)(cid:561) (cid:160)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:152)(cid:158)(cid:157)(cid:561)
obtaining registration from SEBI. Vide an ad 
interim  ex-parte  order  dated  July  09,  2012 
(hereinafter referred to as the ‘interim order’), 
SEBI  directed  NGHI  and  its  promoters  and 
directors  to  immediately  stop  collecting 
money, directly or indirectly, from investors 
(cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:156)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:550)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:139)(cid:162)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)
(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:150)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:158)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:561)
any  further  plans/  schemes  in  the  nature  of 
a  CIS.  The  order  further  directed  the  NGHI 
to  deposit  the  money  collected  from  the 

141

Annual Report 2012-13

investors  in  a  separate  bank  account  within 
a period of 3 days. Thereafter, on request of 
the company, various hearings were granted 
and  it  was  concluded  that  the  transactions 
between NGHI and its customers are not real 
estate  transactions  simpliciter;  rather  they 
(cid:156)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:143)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:149)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:561)(cid:5)(cid:11)(cid:21)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)
under Section 11AA of the SEBI Act, 1992.

Accordingly, an order dated November 
06,  2012  was  passed  against  the  above 
company  for  violation  of  SEBI  (CIS) 
Regulations, 1999. The company was directed

order dated November 9, 2010. The noticees

D. M/s. Maitreya Services Pvt. Ltd. (MSPL)
(cid:17)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:146)(cid:153)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:143)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:143)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:150)(cid:561) (cid:17)(cid:284)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)
The  Income  Tax  alleging  contravention  of 
the SEBI Act and Regulations against MSPL, 
SEBI  sought  information  from  the  company 
regarding its activities. From the examination 
of the information received, it appeared that 
the company is carrying out the activities of 
CIS  and  not  those  of  real  estate,  as  claimed 
by the company. Accordingly, a Show Cause 
Notice  was  issued  to  the  company  and  its 
directors on October 14, 2011 asking them to 
show cause as to why suitable action should 
not  be  initiated  against  them  for  violation 
of  regulation  3  of  SEBI  (CIS)  Regulations, 
1999  read  with  section  11AA  of  the  SEBI 
Act.  Thereafter,  on  request  of  the  company, 
various  hearings  were  also  granted  to  the 
company and its directors where they made 
various submissions regarding their business. 

143

that the company is carrying out CIS activities 
and  hence,  an  order  dated  March  25,  2013 
was passed against the company directing it 
to wind up its existing collective investment 
schemes  and  refund  the  money  collected  by 
it under the schemes with returns which are

C.

Important  Court  Pronouncements  in 
(cid:18)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:158)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:15)(cid:138)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:156)

a.

SEBI  vs.  M/s.  PPL  Pink  Harvest  Ltd. 
and others (C.C. no. 1318/2002)- Before 
Hon’ble Addl. Sessions Judge, Delhi
It has been held that SEBI has proved its 
case beyond reasonable doubt and accordingly 
held guilty M/s. PPL Pink Harvest Ltd. (A-1) 
and Mr. Anurag Bisaria (A-4) for the violation 
of Section 12 (1B) of SEBI Act and Regulation 5 
and 73 of SEBI (CIS) Regulations, 1999. During 
the  trial  proceedings  Mr.  M.L.  Saxena  (A-2) 
and Smt. Asha Saxena (A-3) were abated on 
account of their death.

The court sentenced the A-4 for a period 
(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:156)(cid:146)(cid:161)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:20)(cid:11)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:139)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:160)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:561)(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)
` 1,00,000 (Rupees one lakh only) in default 
convict shall undergo SI for a period of two

III. Disposal of Prosecution Cases
i)
262  cases  were  disposed  by  the  Courts 
till 2012-13, out of which, 148 cases resulted 
in  convictions  and  59  cases  were  fully 
compounded (Table 3.29).

Collective Investment Schemes (CIS)

judgments  have  been  obtained  in  a  total  of 
171 CIS entities (Table 3.29).

9. CONSENT AND COMPOUNDING
During  2012-13,  SEBI  has  received  193 
applications  for  consent  and  compounding. 
Further,  189  consent  applications  and 
six  compounding  applications  were 
rejected  during  the  year.  In  addition,  35 
applications  for  consent  and  compounding 
were  withdrawn  by  the  applicants.  The 
number  of  applications  in  rejection  and 
withdrawal  categories  may  include  the 
(cid:138)(cid:153)(cid:153)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:281)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:141)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:159)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:158)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561)

10. INVESTOR ASSISTANCE AND 

EDUCATION

I. Redressal of Investor Grievances

SEBI has been taking various regulatory 
measures  to  expedite  the  redressal 
of  investor  grievances.  The  grievances 
lodged  by  investors  are  taken  up  with  the 
respective  listed  company  or  intermediary 
and  continuously  monitored.  Grievances 
pertaining  to  stock  brokers  and  depository 
participants  are  taken  up  with  concerned 
stock  exchange  and  depository  for  redressal 

148

Part Three: Regulation of Securities Market

Annual Report 2012-13

The  company/intermediary  is  required  to 
respond  in  prescribed  format  in  the  form  of 
Action Taken Report (ATR). Upon the receipt 
of ATR, the status of grievances is updated. If 
the response of the company/intermediary is 
(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:284)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:550)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:154)(cid:158)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:143)(cid:152)(cid:149)(cid:149)(cid:152)(cid:160)(cid:561) (cid:158)(cid:153)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:561)
initiated. SEBI takes appropriate enforcement 
actions  (Adjudication,  11B  directions, 
Prosecution  etc)  as  provided  under  the  law 
where  progress  in  redressal  of  investor 
grievances is not satisfactory.

The  following  paragraphs  highlight 
SEBI’s  performance  and  measures  taken  in 
the year 2012-13 for expediting the redressal 
of investor grievances.

II. SEBI Complaints Redress System

SEBI  has  received  42,411  complaints 
(cid:141)(cid:158)(cid:155)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561)(cid:162)(cid:142)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:344)(cid:342)(cid:343)(cid:344)(cid:556)(cid:343)(cid:345)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:152)(cid:149)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)
54,852  grievances  cumulatively  as  compared 
to  46,548  grievances  received  and  53,841 
grievances  resolved  in  the  year  2011-12
(Table 3.36).

As on March 31, 2013, there were 11,410 
complaints  pending  resolution  as  compared 
to  23,725  pending  grievances  cumulative 
as  on  March  31,  2012.  The  net  reduction  in 
pending complaints has been 12,315 in 2012-
13 as compared to 4,928 in 2011-12.

SCORES enables the investor to directly 

lodge  the  complaints  online  and  such 
complaints  are  considered  as  ‘e-complaints’. 
During 2012-13, a total of 26,195 e-complaints 
were  received  compared  to  10,635 
(cid:142)(cid:556)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:150)(cid:153)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:146)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:344)(cid:342)(cid:343)(cid:343)(cid:556)(cid:343)(cid:344)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:282)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)
an increase of 146.3 percent over the previous 
year. This indicates that the SCORES system 
has  been  working  satisfactorily  and  has 
helped in making the complaint handling and 
(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:145)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:150)(cid:561)(cid:150)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:284)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:495)

III. R e g u l a t o r y   a c t i o n   a g a i n s t 
Companies  and  their  Directors  for 
non-redressal of Investor Grievances
SEBI  takes  appropriate  enforcement 
actions (adjudication, directions, prosecution 
etc)  as  provided  under  the  law  where 
progress in redressal of investor grievances is 
not satisfactory.
a.

The 11B orders were passed during the 
last  three  years,  against  the  companies 
and  its  directors  debarring  them  from 
accessing the securities market and from 
buying,  selling  or  dealing  in  securities 
directly  or  indirectly,  in  whatsoever 
manner, till all the investor’s grievances 
against  the  company  are  resolved  by 
them. (Table 3.37)

(cid:11)(cid:24)(cid:495)(cid:561) (cid:11)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561)(cid:16)(cid:152)(cid:556)(cid:152)(cid:139)(cid:147)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:5)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)
Companies  raising  capital  through 
public  issue  of  securities  are  required  to 
deposit one percent of the issue amount with 
the designated Stock Exchange. This deposit 
is  released  by  the  Stock  Exchange  only 
(cid:138)(cid:143)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:4)(cid:11)(cid:561) (cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:158)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:138)(cid:561) (cid:16)(cid:152)(cid:561) (cid:17)(cid:139)(cid:147)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:5)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:561)
(NOC). SEBI issues NOC to companies after 
satisfactory  redressal  of  complaints  received 
by SEBI against the Companies.

During  the  year  2012-13,  NOCs  were 
issued to 73 applicant companies. NOCs to 47 
companies were not issued as the applications 
were  incomplete  or  due  to  unsatisfactory 
redressal of investor grievances.

Annual Report 2012-13

V. SEBI Toll Free Helpline

To  facilitate  replies  to  various  queries 
(cid:152)(cid:143)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:561) (cid:144)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561) (cid:153)(cid:158)(cid:139)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:140)(cid:561) (cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561) (cid:150)(cid:138)(cid:308)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:155)(cid:142)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561) (cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561)
securities market, SEBI had launched toll free 
helpline service number 1800 22 7575/1800 266 
7575 on December 30, 2011.

The toll free helpline service is available 
to  investors  from  all  over  India  and  is  in 
(cid:343)(cid:346)(cid:561) (cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:158)(cid:138)(cid:144)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561) (cid:159)(cid:146)(cid:163)(cid:495)(cid:561) (cid:7)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:149)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:145)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:10)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:141)(cid:146)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:15)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:146)(cid:496)(cid:561)
Gujarati, Tamil, Bengali, Malayalam, Telugu, 
Urdu,  Oriya,  Punjabi,  Kannada,  Assamese 
and  Kashmiri.  The  toll  free  helpline  service 

was  initially  available  on  all  working  days 
from Monday to Friday from 9:30 a.m to 5:30 
p.m (excluding declared holidays).

(cid:25)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:143)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:150)(cid:561)(cid:21)(cid:142)(cid:153)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:139)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561)(cid:343)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:344)(cid:342)(cid:343)(cid:344)(cid:496)(cid:561)(cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:4)(cid:11)(cid:561)
has  extended  its  toll  free  helpline  service 
(1800  22  7575  /  1800  266  7575)  to  Saturday 
and  Sunday  also.  The  services  on  Saturday 
and  Sunday  are  available  to  investors  from 
9:30  a.m.  to  5:30  p.m  presently  in  English, 
Hindi,  Marathi  and  Gujarati  only.  The 
number of calls received on Toll Free Helpline 
during the Financial Year 2012-13 is given in 
following chart below.

152

(cid:25)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:561) (cid:142)(cid:283)(cid:142)(cid:140)(cid:157)(cid:561) (cid:143)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:150)(cid:561) (cid:21)(cid:142)(cid:153)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:139)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:561) (cid:344)(cid:342)(cid:343)(cid:344)(cid:496)(cid:561) (cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:4)(cid:11)(cid:561)
Helpline  introduced  an  option  of  receiving 
a feedback from the callers and based on the 
feedback  received  various  measures  have 
been adopted for improvement of the helpline 
services.

SEBI  provides  assistance  /  guidance  to 
investors by replying to their queries received 
through the following modes

(cid:11)(cid:151)(cid:159)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:155)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:159)(cid:146)(cid:156)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:144)(cid:561)(cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:4)(cid:11)(cid:561)(cid:10)(cid:142)(cid:138)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:17)(cid:284)(cid:140)(cid:142)

rendered  to  investors  was  augmented  by 
gathering  details  from  the  FAQs,  Circulars 
etc  available  on  SEBI  website,  and  from  the 
details  gathered  through  e-mail,  phone  calls 
from market intermediaries.

VII. Investor Education - Multimedia 

Campaign
In  December  2012,  SEBI  launched 
a  Multi-media  Investor  Education  and 
Awareness  Campaign,  with  objective 
of  giving  important  messages,  creating 
general  awareness  among  the  investors  and 
prospective  investors  across  the  nation, 
regarding various relevant topics of investor

awareness  regarding  the  products  /

D. Financial Education

With  the  aim  of  spreading  financial 
literacy, SEBI has taken up various programs 
across  the  country.  The  resource  person 
model  developed  by  SEBI  has  been  well 
appreciated internationally as well as by other 
regulators and various ministries.

E.

School Programs
(cid:21)(cid:7)(cid:4)(cid:11)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:151)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561)(cid:14)(cid:146)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:140)(cid:162)(cid:561)(cid:153)(cid:155)(cid:152)(cid:144)(cid:155)(cid:138)(cid:150)(cid:561)
named  ‘Pocket  Money’  for  school  students 
jointly  with  National  Institute  of  Securities 
Market  (NISM)  in  2008-09  and  positioned 
it  as  an  important  life  skill  at  the  school 
level  targeting  mainly  8th  and  9th  standard 
students.

Under  the  Pocket  Money  programme, 
financial  literacy  was  imparted  to  school 
students. It includes orientation programmes 
for the School Principals, training programmes 
for teachers followed by the teachers conducting 
(cid:140)(cid:149)(cid:138)(cid:156)(cid:156)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561)(cid:146)(cid:150)(cid:153)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:157)(cid:561)(cid:281)(cid:151)(cid:138)(cid:151)(cid:140)(cid:146)(cid:138)(cid:149)(cid:561)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:158)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:561)(cid:140)(cid:152)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:151)(cid:157)(cid:156)(cid:561)
covered  in  the  pocket  money  programme  to 
the  students.  At  the  end  of  the  programme, 
examination is conducted for the students and 
(cid:140)(cid:142)(cid:155)(cid:157)(cid:146)(cid:281)(cid:140)(cid:138)(cid:157)(cid:142)(cid:156)(cid:561)(cid:138)(cid:160)(cid:138)(cid:155)(cid:141)(cid:142)(cid:141)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:152)(cid:561)(cid:157)(cid:145)(cid:142)(cid:150)(cid:495)

During  the  year  2012-13,  twenty-five 
programs  being  conducted,  benefiting  a 
total  of  1,180  Teachers  were  conducted. 
The  programme  could  reach  to  150  schools 
covering  5,072  students  during  the  year. 
Programme was also conducted in schools in 
Kerala, Karnataka, Mumbai and Tamil Nadu. 
(cid:507)(cid:22)(cid:138)(cid:139)(cid:149)(cid:142)(cid:561)(cid:345)(cid:495)(cid:346)(cid:345)(cid:508)(cid:563)

the  empanelled  RP  is  also  required  to  abide

conduct.  The  workshops  conducted  through 
the  Resource  Persons  are  usually  for  2  to  3 
hrs  duration  where  the  SEBI  study  material 
is distributed free of cost to the participants.

The  study  material  developed  for  the 
above  target  groups  is  presently  available 
in  10  vernacular  languages  covering  various 
topics.
